file_content.text: Here's the data from the probe droids.
You're a lifesaver! The captain's been breathing down my neck waiting for this.
Something for your troubles, as agreed.
I really appreciate this. The last thing I need is a captain who's mad at me.
Everything okay out here?
Not really. I kind of messed up. But it's not my fault. The captain should have made his orders more clear.
Told me to slice the signals directing the Imperial probe droids flying over the camp. "Bring 'em down, Feero!" he said. So I did.
He never told me we had to recover the droids after they crashed! Now he acts like this is my fault.
A good soldier doesn't talk behind his commanding officer's back.
Don't disrespect your captain!
Whoever's fault this was, you should try to focus on the solution.
Assigning blame doesn't help.
That's the problem with the military. Some clueless captain makes a mess, then he expects you enlisted guys to clean it up.
Glad I don't answer to him.
Instead of complaining about your commander, you should be trying to find a solution.
You have to make this right.
Better give me the details.
It sounds like you may have ticked off your commanding officer.
So you're in trouble now?
I was just trying to go above and beyond the call of duty. You'd think he'd appreciate that.
I figured crashing the probe droids wasn't enough. So I rerouted them to hit the ground in the middle of a minefield.
Thought it would be a nasty surprise when the Imperials went to retrieve them. Hopefully take a few of them out.
You showed initiative.
The captain didn't see it that way. He just wants the intel from those probe droids.
You wouldn't be in this mess if you'd just stuck to your captain's basic plan.
Soldiers shouldn't improvise.
If he'd told me the whole plan from the beginning, I wouldn't have crashed the droids in the middle of a minefield!
The captain wants the intel from those droids, but he doesn't want to send his troops into the minefield.
Now I see the problem.
I need to find someone willing to retrieve the data from those droids. So far, I haven't had any volunteers.
I'll take care of this.
I'll help--for a price.
I'm pretty sure we can come up with some credits for you. The captain really wants that intel.
Here's the location of the crash site. Good luck out there....
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
For a minute there, I thought you were going to help me out. Too bad.
Don't hang around after you've got that intel. Hold your nose and run, maybe.
That intel was a gold mine. Internal comms, invasion strategy, military codes....
Sorry, can't talk now. I've got to monitor these droids.
Wait, please. I haven't got any backup. Squad like you might at least have a chance.
Master Jedi! I didn't know the Order was sending backup. Guess my luck's not all bad.
Captain. I don't mean to stop you in the middle of an op, but I could use your help.
Looking to make some creds? I can promise a captain's pay grade if you're for hire.
The captain's the one who insisted we had to have that intel. He's the one who should be out here, begging for help.
Normally I wouldn't ask someone to do my job, but we've got some very valuable intel trapped behind enemy lines.
We're near the ruins of Traken-4, one of the Empire's first outposts here. The whole area's a toxic lake now...chemicals, runoff, the works.
The area's a mess, but the intel the Imps left behind would be invaluable. I'm no methane-breather, so I sent in probe droids to get it.
The Imperials must have detected my droids in the area. They sent a HazMat squad in and set up camp. They want that intel destroyed.
I managed to get the droids somewhere safe, but now they're stuck. I bring them out, and the Imps will use them for target practice.
Yes, sir. Sorry, sir. Just let me brief you on the situation.
Try telling that to the captain. He wants that intel yesterday.
Of course, Master Jedi. Luckily that's where you come in.
There's no need to beg.
Just get to the point.
Thanks. I just hope you're still willing after you hear the details.
But something went wrong?
Can't help you. [Refuse quest]
Maybe I can self-destruct the droids from here. The captain won't be happy....
Imps don't scare me.
Not if I use them first.
Glad to hear that. The HazMat squad won't be your ordinary Imps.
As long as nothing happens to my droids, you've got my blessing.
Here. Coordinates to where I hid the droids. Move fast, or those toxic fumes might start to affect your aim.
And watch out for that HazMat squad. They'll have protective gear. Their aim will be fine.
Everything looks intact. I can't believe you made it out. Those HazMat troops looked like they were made of durasteel.
The captain authorized me to give you this. He's chomping at the bit for this intel. I'll tell him he has you to thank.
It's only long term exposure that might be fatal. That intel wasn't exactly lying around in the open.
Methane? Wait a minute....
Sounds like your problem.
I need someone who can handle hazardous conditions, or I sent those droids in there for nothing.
